meanings.definition: Obtain (something) by using persuasion or guile.
meanings.sent1: He blagged his way into the concert by pretending to be a VIP.
meanings.sent2: She blagged some extra time to finish her homework by sweet-talking the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox blagged some extra treats from the farmer by looking extra cute.
meanings.sent4: The sly cat blagged its way into the house by pretending to be a lost pet.
meanings.sent5: The smooth-talking salesman blagged a great deal on the car by charming the customer.

meanings.sent1: The thief blagged the jewels from the museum under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: She blagged some candy from the store when the clerk wasn't looking.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon blagged some food from the campsite while everyone was asleep.
meanings.sent4: The pirate blagged the treasure from the ship with cunning tactics.
meanings.sent5: The clever magpie blagged shiny objects to decorate its nest.

meanings.sent1: The con artist blagged unsuspecting victims out of their money with false promises.
meanings.sent2: He blagged his way out of trouble by spinning a convincing story.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun blagged the children into searching for his pot of gold.
meanings.sent4: The illusionist blagged the audience with his mind-bending tricks.
meanings.sent5: The prankster blagged his friends into believing the outrageous story.
